```{r setup, include=FALSE}
library(tidyverse)
```

## Introduction




## Load Data

```{r load_data}
data_2020 <- read.csv("data/sentiment_country_2020.csv")
data_2021 <- read.csv("data/sentiment_country_2021.csv")
```


```{r viewing scores}
view(data_2020)
view(data_2021)
```

## Visualize Data

```{r}
data_total <- rbind(data_2020,data_2021)

ggplot (data=data_total, aes(DATE, SCORE))+
  geom_point(alpha = 0.4)

```





```{r avg score 2020}

avg_data_2020<-data_2020 %>%
  group_by(NAME_0) %>%
  summarize(
    avg_score_2020 = mean(SCORE, na.rm = TRUE)
    )

#view(avg_data_2020)

names(avg_data_2020)[names(avg_data_2020) == "NAME_0"] <- "region"

#view(avg_data_2020_1)
```

```{r range of scores 2020}
ggplot(data = data_2020, aes(x=SCORE)) + 
  geom_histogram(binwidth = 0.01, fill = "lightblue")+ 
  ylab("Frequency") + 
  xlab("sentiment score") +
  ggtitle("Distribution of Sentiment scores of the tweets")
```


```{r avg scores per country}
ggplot(data = avg_data_2020, aes(x=region, y=avg_score_2020)) + 
  geom_bar(stat = "identity")+
  coord_flip()
```

 
```{r world map plot}
mapdata <- map_data("world") ##ggplot2
#View(mapdata)

#changing USA to United States
mapdata$region[mapdata$region == "USA"] <- "United States"

#changing UK to United Kingdom
mapdata$region[mapdata$region == "UK"] <- "United Kingdom"

mapdata <- left_join(mapdata, avg_data_2020, by="region")
#View(mapdata)


mapdata1<-mapdata %>% filter(!is.na(mapdata$avg_score_2020))
#View(mapdata1)

map1<-ggplot(mapdata1, aes( x = long, y = lat, group=group)) +
  geom_polygon(aes(fill = avg_score_2020), color = "black")


map2 <- map1 + scale_fill_gradient(name = "avg score", low = "light blue", high =  "black", na.value = "grey50")+
  theme(axis.text.x = element_blank(),
        axis.text.y = element_blank(),
        axis.ticks = element_blank(),
        axis.title.y=element_blank(),
        axis.title.x=element_blank(),
        rect = element_blank())
map2
```

```{r avg sentiments and gdp }
names(gdp_2020)[names(gdp_2020) == "Country Name"] <- "region"
#view(gdp_2020)

avg_data_2020 <- left_join(avg_data_2020, gdp_2020, by="region")
#View(avg_data_2020)

#only for daily data

names(data_2020)[names(data_2020) == "NAME_0"] <- "region"

daily_data_2020  <- left_join(data_2020, gdp_2020, by="region")
names(daily_data_2020)[names(daily_data_2020) == "2020 [YR2020]"] <- "gdp_2020_values"
```

```{r compare_variables 2020 AVERAGE}

#removing missing values
avg_data_2020<-avg_data_2020[!(avg_data_2020$gdp_2020_values==".."),]
#view(df2)


avg_data_2020$gdp_2020_values <- as.numeric(as.character(avg_data_2020$gdp_2020_values))
#view(df3)

avg_data_2020$gdp_2020_values =  (avg_data_2020$gdp_2020_values) / 1000000000
#view(df3)

#df3<-df2 %>% filter(!is.na(df2$gdp_2020_values))
#View(df3)

#sentiment scores
ggplot(data = avg_data_2020, aes(x = avg_score_2020)) + 
  geom_histogram()

#gdp values
ggplot(avg_data_2020, aes(x = region, y = gdp_2020_values )) +  
  geom_bar(stat = "identity")

#comparing both the variables
ggplot(data = avg_data_2020, aes(x = gdp_2020_values , y = avg_score_2020))+ 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()
```
```{r compare_variables 2020 DAILY}

#removing missing values
daily_data_2020<-daily_data_2020[!(daily_data_2020$gdp_2020_values==".."),]
#view(df2)


daily_data_2020$gdp_2020_values <- as.numeric(as.character(daily_data_2020$gdp_2020_values))
#view(df3)

daily_data_2020$gdp_2020_values =  (daily_data_2020$gdp_2020_values) / 10000000000000
#view(df3)

daily_data_2020<-daily_data_2020 %>% filter(!is.na(daily_data_2020$gdp_2020_values))
#View(df3)

#sentiment scores

#gdp values
ggplot(adaily_data_2020, aes(x = region, y = gdp_2020_values )) +

```
```{r regression1 DAILY}

library(brms)
dv <- brm(formula = SCORE~gdp_2020_values, data=daily_data_2020, family=gaussian ,refresh=0)

```

```{r sum_model1 DAILY}
summary(dv)
```

```{r plot_uncertainty_coef1 DAILY}
attach(daily_data_2020)
uncertainty_coef<-as_draws_df(dv, variable = "b_gdp_2020_values")
ggplot(uncertainty_coef, aes(x=b_gdp_2020_values))+geom_density()+labs(title= "Uncertainty in regression coefficient",
                                                                  x="Regression Coefficient",
                                                                  y="Uncertainty")
```

```{r plot_effects1 DAILY}
conditional_effects(dv,effects="gdp_2020_values")
```

```{r}
internet_2020 <- read.csv("internet_2020.csv")

internet_2020 <- internet_2020[c(2,3)]

internet_2020<-internet_2020 %>% filter(!is.na(internet_2020$X.1))

internet_2020<-internet_2020 %>%  filter(!row_number() %in% c(1, 2, 3, 4))
#view(internet_2020)

names(internet_2020)[names(internet_2020) == "X.1"] <- "region"
names(internet_2020)[names(internet_2020) == "X.2"] <- "users"

df4<-left_join(internet_2020, avg_data_2020, by="region")
#view(df4)

df4<-df4 %>% filter(!is.na(df4$avg_score_2020))

df4$users <- as.numeric(as.character(df4$users))

ggplot(data = df4, aes(x = users , y = avg_score_2020))+ 
  geom_point() + 
  geom_smooth()

```
```{r regression2}

library(brms)
dv <- brm(formula = avg_score_2020~ users, data=df4, family=gaussian ,refresh=0)

```

```{r plot_reg_coefs2}
draws_fit <- as_draws_df(dv)
posterior::summarize_draws(draws_fit)
```

```{r cond_eff_coefs2}
conditional_effects(dv)
```
```{r regression3}
dv <- brm(formula = avg_score_2020~gdp_2020_values * users, data=df4, family=gaussian ,refresh=0)
```
```{r plot_reg_coefs3}
draws_fit <- as_draws_df(dv)
posterior::summarize_draws(draws_fit)
```
```{r cond_eff_coefs3}
conditional_effects(dv)
```
